intro: Labatia hotteana, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments.
